key.name: tabs-open-position
key.summary: Where to position newly open tabs in browser windows.
key.description: If set to "after-current-tab", then new tabs are inserted after the current tab. If set to "end", then new tabs are appended to the end of the tab list.

key.name: ctrl-tab-switch-tabs
key.description: If true, it enables the ability to switch tabs using [ctrl + tab] and [ctrl + shift + tab].

key.name: exit-with-last-window
key.summary: Caja will exit when last window destroyed.
key.description: If set to true, then Caja will exit when all windows are destroyed. This is the default setting. If set to false, it can be started without any window, so Caja can serve as a daemon to monitor media automount, or similar tasks.

key.name: always-use-browser
key.summary: Enables the classic Caja behavior, where all windows are browsers
key.description: If set to true, then all Caja windows will be browser windows. This is how Nautilus used to behave before version 2.6, and some people prefer this behavior.

key.name: always-use-location-entry
key.summary: Always use the location entry, instead of the pathbar
key.description: If set to true, then Caja browser windows will always use a textual input entry for the location toolbar, instead of the pathbar.

key.name: confirm-trash
key.summary: Whether to ask for confirmation when deleting files, or emptying Trash
key.description: If set to true, then Caja will ask for confirmation when you attempt to delete files, or empty the Trash.

key.name: confirm-move-to-trash
key.summary: Whether to ask for confirmation when moving files to the Trash
key.description: If set to true, then Caja will ask for confirmation when you attempt to move files to the Trash.

key.name: enable-delete
key.description: If set to true, then Caja will have a feature allowing you to delete a file immediately and in-place, instead of moving it to the trash. This feature can be dangerous, so use caution.

key.name: show-icon-text
key.summary: When to show preview text in icons
key.description: Speed tradeoff for when to show a preview of text file contents in the file's icon. If set to "always" then always show previews, even if the folder is on a remote server. If set to "local-only" then only show previews for local file systems. If set to "never" then never bother to read preview data.

key.name: show-directory-item-counts
key.summary: When to show number of items in a folder
key.description: Speed tradeoff for when to show the number of items in a folder. If set to "always" then always show item counts, even if the folder is on a remote server. If set to "local-only" then only show counts for local file systems. If set to "never" then never bother to compute item counts.

key.name: click-policy
key.summary: Type of click used to launch/open files
key.description: Possible values are "single" to launch files on a single click, or "double" to launch them on a double click.

key.name: executable-text-activation
key.summary: What to do with executable text files when activated
key.description: What to do with executable text files when they are activated (single or double clicked). Possible values are "launch" to launch them as programs, "ask" to ask what to do via a dialog, and "display" to display them as text files.

key.name: install-mime-activation
key.summary: Show the package installer for unknown MIME types
key.description: Whether to show the user a package installer dialog in case an unknown MIME type is opened, in order to search for an application to handle it.

key.name: mouse-use-extra-buttons
key.summary: Use extra mouse button events in Caja' browser window
key.description: For users with mice that have "Forward" and "Back" buttons, this key will determine if any action is taken inside of Caja when either is pressed.

key.name: mouse-forward-button
key.summary: Mouse button to activate the "Forward" command in browser window
key.description: For users with mice that have buttons for "Forward" and "Back", this key will set which button activates the "Forward" command in a browser window. Possible values range between 6 and 14.

key.name: mouse-back-button
key.summary: Mouse button to activate the "Back" command in browser window
key.description: For users with mice that have buttons for "Forward" and "Back", this key will set which button activates the "Back" command in a browser window. Possible values range between 6 and 14.

key.name: show-image-thumbnails
key.summary: When to show thumbnails of image files
key.description: Speed tradeoff for when to show an image file as a thumbnail. If set to "always" then always thumbnail, even if the folder is on a remote server. If set to "local-only" then only show thumbnails for local file systems. If set to "never" then never bother to thumbnail images, just use a generic icon.

key.name: thumbnail-limit
key.description: Images over this size (in bytes) won't be thumbnailed. The purpose of this setting is to avoid thumbnailing large images that may take a long time to load or use lots of memory.

key.name: preview-sound
key.summary: Whether to preview sounds when mousing over an icon
key.description: Speed tradeoff for when to preview a sound file when mousing over a files icon. If set to "always" then always plays the sound, even if the file is on a remote server. If set to "local-only" then only plays previews on local file systems. If set to "never" then it never previews sound.

key.name: show-advanced-permissions
key.summary: Show advanced permissions in the file property dialog
key.description: If set to true, then Caja lets you edit and display file permissions in a more unix-like way, accessing some more esoteric options.

key.name: sort-directories-first
key.description: If set to true, then Caja shows folders prior to showing files in the icon and list views.

key.name: default-sort-order
key.description: The default sort-order for items in the icon view. Possible values are "name", "size", "type", "mtime", and "emblems".

key.name: default-sort-in-reverse-order
key.summary: Reverse sort order in new windows
key.description: If true, files in new windows will be sorted in reverse order. ie, if sorted by name, then instead of sorting the files from "a" to "z", they will be sorted from "z" to "a"; if sorted by size, instead of being incrementally they will be sorted decrementally.

key.name: desktop-is-home-dir
key.summary: Caja uses the users home folder as the desktop
key.description: If set to true, then Caja will use the user's home folder as the desktop. If it is false, then it will use ~/Desktop as the desktop.

key.name: background-set
key.description: Whether a custom default folder background has been set.

key.name: background-color
key.description: Color for the default folder background. Only used if background_set is true.

key.name: background-uri
key.description: Uri of the default folder background. Only used if background_set is true.

key.name: side-pane-background-set
key.description: Whether a custom default side pane background has been set.

key.name: side-pane-background-color
key.description: Filename for the default side pane background. Only used if side_pane_background_set is true.

key.name: side-pane-background-uri
key.description: Uri of the default side pane background. Only used if side_pane_background_set is true.

key.name: default-folder-viewer
key.description: When a folder is visited this viewer is used unless you have selected another view for that particular folder. Possible values are "list-view", "icon-view" and "compact-view".

key.name: date-format
key.description: The format of file dates. Possible values are "locale", "iso", and "informal".

key.name: show-hidden-files
key.description: If set to true, then hidden files are shown by default in the file manager. Hidden files are either dotfiles or listed in the folder's .hidden file.

key.name: show-backup-files
key.description: If set to true, then backup files are shown by default in the file manager. Backup files are backup files ending with a tilde (~).

key.name: use-iec-units
key.summary: Whether to show file sizes with IEC units
key.description: If set to true, file sizes are shown using IEC (base 1024) units with "KiB" style suffixes, instead of default with SI units.

key.name: show-icons-in-list-view
key.summary: Whether to show icons in list view
key.description: If set to true, show file icons in list view.

key.name: show-notifications
key.description: If set to true, Caja will show desktop notifications.

key.name: captions
key.summary: List of possible captions on icons
key.description: A list of captions below an icon in the icon view and the desktop. The actual number of captions shown depends on the zoom level. Some possible values are: "size", "type", "date_modified", "date_changed", "date_accessed", "owner", "group", "permissions", "octal_permissions" and "mime_type".

key.name: default-use-tighter-layout
key.summary: Use tighter layout in new windows
key.description: If true, icons will be laid out tighter by default in new windows.

key.name: labels-beside-icons
key.description: If true, labels will be placed beside icons rather than underneath them.

key.name: default-zoom-level
key.description: Default zoom level used by the icon view.

key.name: thumbnail-size
key.description: The default size of an icon for a thumbnail in the icon view.

key.name: text-ellipsis-limit
key.description:
A string specifying how parts of overlong file names should be replaced by ellipses, depending on the zoom level. Each of the list entries is of the form "Zoom Level:Integer". For each specified zoom level, if the given integer is larger than 0, the file name will not exceed the given number of lines. If the integer is 0 or smaller, no limit is imposed on the specified zoom level. A default entry of the form "Integer" without any specified zoom level is also allowed. It defines the maximum number of lines for all other zoom levels. Examples: 0 - always display overlong file names; 3 - shorten file names if they exceed three lines; smallest:5,smaller:4,0 - shorten file names if they exceed five lines for zoom level "smallest". Shorten file names if they exceed four lines for zoom level "smaller". Do not shorten file names for other zoom levels.
Available zoom levels: smallest (33%), smaller (50%), small (66%), standard (100%), large (150%), larger (200%), largest (400%)

key.name: default-zoom-level
key.description: Default zoom level used by the compact view.

key.name: all-columns-have-same-width
key.description: If this preference is set, all columns in the compact view have the same width. Otherwise, the width of each column is determined seperately.

key.name: default-zoom-level
key.description: Default zoom level used by the list view.

key.name: default-visible-columns
key.summary: Default list of columns visible in the list view
key.description: Default list of columns visible in the list view.

key.name: default-column-order
key.summary: Default column order in the list view
key.description: Default column order in the list view.

key.name: show-only-directories
key.summary: Only show folders in the tree side pane
key.description: If set to true, Caja will only show folders in the tree side pane. Otherwise it will show both folders and files.

key.name: font
key.description: The font description used for the icons on the desktop.

key.name: home-icon-visible
key.description: If this is set to true, an icon linking to the home folder will be put on the desktop.

key.name: computer-icon-visible
key.description: If this is set to true, an icon linking to the computer location will be put on the desktop.

key.name: trash-icon-visible
key.description: If this is set to true, an icon linking to the trash will be put on the desktop.

key.name: volumes-visible
key.summary: Show mounted volumes on the desktop
key.description: If this is set to true, icons linking to mounted volumes will be put on the desktop.

key.name: network-icon-visible
key.summary: Network Servers icon visible on the desktop
key.description: If this is set to true, an icon linking to the Network Servers view will be put on the desktop.

key.name: computer-icon-name
key.description: This name can be set if you want a custom name for the computer icon on the desktop.

key.name: home-icon-name
key.description: This name can be set if you want a custom name for the home icon on the desktop.

key.name: trash-icon-name
key.description: This name can be set if you want a custom name for the trash icon on the desktop.

key.name: network-icon-name
key.description: This name can be set if you want a custom name for the network servers icon on the desktop.

key.name: text-ellipsis-limit
key.description: An integer specifying how parts of overlong file names should be replaced by ellipses on the desktop. If the number is larger than 0, the file name will not exceed the given number of lines. If the number is 0 or smaller, no limit is imposed on the number of displayed lines.

key.name: geometry
key.summary: The geometry string for a navigation window.
key.description: A string containing the saved geometry and coordinates string for navigation windows.

key.name: maximized
key.summary: Whether the navigation window should be maximized.
key.description: Whether the navigation window should be maximized by default.

key.name: sidebar-width
key.description: The default width of the side pane in new windows.

key.name: start-with-toolbar
key.description: If set to true, newly opened windows will have toolbars visible.

key.name: start-with-location-bar
key.summary: Show location bar in new windows
key.description: If set to true, newly opened windows will have the location bar visible.

key.name: start-with-status-bar
key.summary: Show status bar in new windows
key.description: If set to true, newly opened windows will have the status bar visible.

key.name: start-with-sidebar
key.summary: Show side pane in new windows
key.description: If set to true, newly opened windows will have the side pane visible.

key.name: side-pane-view
key.description: The side pane view to show in newly opened windows.

key.name: disabled-extensions
key.summary: List of extensions in disabled state.
key.description: This list contains the extensions that are currently de-activated.
